natural.translation[0].definitions[0].de: existing in nature and not caused, made, or controlled by people
natural.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: the study of the natural world  (=trees, rivers, animals, plants etc)
an area of spectacular natural beauty
natural disasters  (=things such as floods or earthquakes)
the need for natural light in offices
natural.translation[0].definitions[1].de: normal and as you would expect
natural.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: At the time, accepting his offer had seemed the most natural thing in the world.
It’s only natural that he should be interested in what happens.
It was a perfectly natural  (=not surprising) mistake to make.
It’s not natural for a child of his age to be so quiet.
it is natural (for somebody) to do something
natural.translation[0].definitions[2].de: a natural tendency or type of behaviour is part of your character when you are born, rather than one that you learn later
natural.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: Babies have a natural fear of falling.
natural.translation[0].definitions[3].de: having a particular quality or skill without needing to be taught and without needing to try hard
natural.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: Cheryl has a natural elegance about her.
natural.translation[0].definitions[4].de: behaving in a way that is normal and shows you are relaxed and not trying to pretend
natural.translation[0].definitions[5].de: someone’s natural parent or child is their real parent or child, who is biologically related to them
natural.translation[0].definitions[5].ex: An adopted young person has the right to trace his natural parents.
natural.translation[0].definitions[6].de: if someone is the natural child of someone, their parents were not married to each other
natural.translation[0].definitions[6].ex: He was rumoured to be the natural son of a duke.
natural.translation[0].definitions[7].de: not connected with gods, magic, or spirits
natural.translation[0].definitions[7].ex: I’m sure there’s a perfectly natural explanation.
natural.translation[0].definitions[8].de: with nothing added to change the taste
natural.translation[0].definitions[9].de: a musical note that is natural has been raised from a flat by one semitone or lowered from a sharp by one semitone
natural.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: existing in nature and not caused, made, or controlled by people
We only use natural ingredients in our products.
used about flowers, plants, and animals that are not controlled by people. Also used about areas of land where there are no humans
used about food, drink, or materials that have not had anything added to them
used about fruit, vegetables, meat etc produced without using chemicals
a place that is unspoiled is still beautiful because no one has built roads or buildings on it
It was a pleasant unspoilt village.
a place that is untouched has not been affected by human activity
There are few forested areas of the world that remain untouched by humans.
virgin forest or land is still in its natural state and has not been spoiled or changed in any way by humans
Large areas of virgin rainforest will be protected from destruction.
He bought 14,000 acres of virgin land in Ontario.
natural.translation[1].definitions[0].de: a musical note that has been changed from a flat to be a semitone higher, or from a sharp to be a semitone lower
natural.translation[1].definitions[1].de: the sign in written music that shows this kind of musical note
natural.translation[2].definitions[0].de: not caused, made, or controlled by human beings
natural.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: A series of natural disasters created huge losses for the insurance market.
All our hair-care products are made from natural ingredients.
natural.translation[2].definitions[1].de: happening as a normal part of a process or situation
natural.translation[2].definitions[1].ex: There is a natural career progression through the police force.
The company termed the organizational changes a ‘natural evolution’ of its global business.
